alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 4:36PM EDT until July 07 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL CHESTER COUNTY... At 436 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported stranded cars due to flash flooding in Exton. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Downingtown, Lionville, Lionville-Marchwood, Chester Springs, Glenmoore, and Exton. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 307 and 317. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
